I have examined the arguments presented so far. Key points that make my team suspicious include:

* Repeated questioning of other players for information and attempts to deflect suspicion
* Motive-based accusations without concrete evidence
* Lack of consistency in my behavior and actions (e.g. dismissing other players' concerns for efficiency)
* Indications of possible back-switching or manipulating information
* Discrepancies in behavior, especially with the recent discussion between players_4 and_6

The indication that suggests I am the Mafia player is the repeated questioning and the inability to provide concrete evidence for their motives.

It is time to bring this discussion to a close and make a decision based on what I know.

Based on my own behavior, I did not ask for much of Player_1 or Player_2 at all. I kept to my post-game post based on my own logic, disregarding Player_3's request. This implies that I'm not the Mafia leader I initially thought. I don't have any conflicts with Player_6, so chances to be the surprise meek player; I am the most likely victim, being the only one who got the less information as I did not ask for anything.

My clear evidence of my suspicious behavior means I am the most likely candidate
